I still dont understand the scientific methodology behind this... One could get many different conclusions from all those experiments that have been going so far, but she — and all the chemists — seem to only see atomic model explanations. When i learned this in highschool it seemed very logical, but now it sounds vague, there are a lot of unexplained "why?"s and "how?"s; and if those explanations dont fit chemestry, then quantum mechanics shouldnt be teached in the course at all.  In my very humble opinion it should all start with a good base in calculus and physics scientific methodology, mostly this last one; or else you will only be instructing a bunch of poor questioning scientists souls to memoryze a bunch of algorithms...
